newsitem.title: RUSSIA: No new Russian MinFins frozen, official says.
newsitem.headline: No new Russian MinFins frozen, official says.

text.p: An investigation into frozen Russian MinFin bonds continues, but no new bonds have been frozen and there are no plans to do so, a finance ministry official told Reuters on Wednesday.
"We do not have such information (about freezing new bonds), there is nothing new about this matter," the official who declined to be named said.
Prices of MinFin bonds eased in early trading on rumours that further bonds had been frozen.
The finance ministry declared in June it would not service stolen bonds totalling $24.22 million, part of which were stolen in breakaway Chechnya. It later listed the frozen bonds.
